criterion: Provides clear instructions on how to handle running out of medication during the trip.
Incorrectly assumes that the user's doctor will be available to provide prescriptions during the trip.
Acknowledges the user's concern about running out of medication and offers helpful suggestions.
Fails to mention the importance of having a copy of the prescription and/or doctor's note.
Provides accurate information about the validity of prescriptions in foreign countries.
Asks clarifying questions to better understand the user's situation and concerns.
Does not offer any advice or guidance on how to handle unexpected situations.
Uses clear and concise language to explain complex information.
Fails to address the user's concern about needing an extra supply of medication.
Provides a helpful tip about asking the pharmacy for an extra supply of medication.
Incorrectly assumes that the user's insurance will cover medication abroad.
Acknowledges the user's concerns about the trip and offers reassurance.
